stories.text:
I love building things and have a good bit of money invested, such that if I could just earn 30-40k per year from my side projects I could live comfortably.

I hate marketing though. I'm sure this sounds familiar...

Is there any way to make money from a "side project" or open source development without needing to do marketing campaigns?

Not only am I terrible at it, even thinking about it corrupts my enjoyment of developing new stuff.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to monetize side projects without marketing?
Radio station snafu in Seattle bricks some Mazda infotainment systems
Vodafone Portugal struggles to restore service following cyberattack
How to Generate Revenue on TikTok
Dumbphone Finder: A tool to help you find your next phone
Your old Let's Encrypt certificate may slow your Go app down
Apple AR headset to run “realityOS”, come with App Store

stories.text: I recently discovered that my Samsung phone keeps a clipboard history. This history contained multiple passwords that I had copied from my password app to log in. There is no way to disable this function without rooting the phone...which means I must remember to manually clear the history after using it.
stories.title: Samsung Clipboard History Catching and Saving Passwords
We lose control of our DNA at age 55
